p: Frequency of MDRO detection on high‐touch surfaces in clinics/practices A‐G was 3%, 27%, 28%, 0%, 26%, 4% and 6%, respectively. In clinics with high environmental contamination, CP‐ E. coli ( bla OXA‐48, bla OXA‐181), CP ‐K. pneumoniae ( bla OXA‐48 ) and MRSP ( mecA, ST551)(clinic B), MRCoNS ( mecA)(clinic C), and Macrococcus spp. (mecB, mecD) and MRCoNS ( mecA)(clinic E) predominated. IPC audits revealed deficits in IPC organization, cleaning/disinfection, hand/personal hygiene, medication preparation and antimicrobial use guidelines in these clinics.
